DOC.brief_summary: Title : Evaluating New Radiation Techniques Cardiovascular Imaging Background : - Imaging study compute tomography ( CT ) scan involve use radiation create picture . Heart blood vessel CT scan cause high radiation exposure . Different method create CT picture develop reduce radiation dose . Researchers want see effective new method produce accurate CT scan . Objectives : - To study new way take picture heart blood vessel use computed tomography . Eligibility : - Adults least 18 year age image study help detect heart blood vessel problem . Design : - Participants screen physical exam medical history . Blood sample take check kidney function . - Participants CT scan heart blood vessel . A contrast agent may use improve quality image . The scan session may last 2 hour . - Participants follow-up contact 90 day scan , yearly contact next 5 year .
DOC.brief_title: Evaluating New Radiation Techniques Cardiovascular Imaging
DOC.detailed_description: Cardiac CT angiography associate radiation exposure . Different method create CT picture develop reduce radiation dose subject . The purpose research study learn whether new image method accurate predict subject outcome .
DOC.criteria: INCLUSION CRITERIA : 1 . Clinical indication coronary CT angiography exam 2 . Age equal great 18 year 3 . Able understand willing sign Informed Consent Form 4 . Able willing provide followup information 90 day yearly 5 year EXCLUSION CRITERIA : 1 . Pregnancy 2 . Severe renal excretory dysfunction , estimate glomerular filtration rate < 30 mL/min/1.73m2 body surface area accord Modification Diet Renal Disease criterion Glomerular filtration rate estimate use MDRD 2005 revise study formula : eGFR ( mL/min/1.73m2 ) = 175 x ( standardized serum creatinine ) 1.154 x ( age ) 0.203 x 0.742 ( subject female ) x 1.212 ( subject black )
